channel.title: Updates: Public Housing Tenant Terminations [Records Request]
channel.description: Updates on the Data Liberation Project's Public Housing Tenant Terminations request

item.title: Appeal Partly Granted
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On August 8, 2024, HUD responded to our appeal ðŸ“„, partly granting it and partly denying it. HUD takes the stance that the aggregated summary data are the only segregable portions of the records, and that providing any additional details would impinge on tenants’ personal privacy. HUD has agreed, however, to check whether the records can be provided in a spreadsheet format rather than as a PDF.

item.title: Appeal Filed
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On July 12, 2024, after several months of seeking clarification from HUD and improvement of the records provided, the Data Liberation Project filed an appeal ðŸ“„ of the agency’s response. The appeal has been assigned tracking number 24-A-HQ-00043.

item.title: Initial Determination Provided
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On April 19, 2024, HUD provided a determination letter ðŸ“„ (dated April 12, 2024) and 19 pages of records ðŸ“„ it considered responsive to the request; unfortunately, those records provided only aggregate summary information, rather than the actual records requested.

item.title: Request Acknowledged, Placed on "Complex" Track
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On April 27, 2023, HUD emailed a letter ðŸ“„ acknowledging this request and placing it on the agency’s “complex” processing track.
